Sunhawk saluted.

Sunhawk:  SIR YES SIR!

He proceeded to leave the ship in hawk mode and stared circling 
around the ship with a 5 mile radius and increasing it by half a mile 
with every circle.

OOC: I'm assuming I can make up what he sees instead of having the 
council make a landscape, but I have no idea what would make a good 
position for a sensor although I'm under the impression of a high 
spot.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Jonathan" <jhogan@r...> wrote:
> > Sunhawk:  I read the full report about the Beast Wars and after 
we've
> > located the Predicons I'd suggest coping a tactic they once 
used.  We
> > steal the energon shelding device they'll inevitably have to use 
and
> > force them to stay in Beast Mode constantly.  Then while they 
sleep
> > the Beast Modes will take over leaving them helpless and at our
> > mercy.  We can then use parts from there ship to repair our own 
and
> > get the Pit out of here.
> >
> 
> {Talos}
> Deck 2, CR Chamber
> 
> Talos considered Sunhawks words motioning him to relax. "First we 
have to
> find the stolen ship and deal with the predicons, as is we need 
some recon.
> Since the sensors are up at least for a certain range we should be 
able to
> spot any forces en route if they're within weapons fire range. Do 
some recon
> outside, recruit another bot or two if you need, try and find a good
> location for construction of a sensor enhancement tower, the longer 
sight
> and comm range we have the more secure our position will be."
> 
>     Turning he adjusted the comm for a ship wide broadcast and 
finding
> repairs already showing a noticeable improvement in the operations,
> "Excellent work people, we have some scanning ability, comms should 
be
> repaired fully soon and then we can get back to our primary 
mission. When
> finished with your current activities report to the mess hall, I'm 
sure you
> could all use some energon and rest. That is all..."
> 
>     Looking back at Sunhawk, "And you have your new orders 
lieutenant, a
> prime spot for the signal enhancer is extremely important. Hop to."
